title: 1,416 foreigners deported since 2021, Assam Assembly told
content: A total of 32,207 people were identified as foreigners staying illegally in the State between January 2021 and October 2025, Assam Accord Implementation Minister Atul Bora said

title: Andhra Pradesh BJP chief accuses Congress and Nehru family of undermining Constitution
content: At a Constitution Day event in Vijayawada, Madhav alleges that Congress humiliated Ambedkar and weakened his ideals, contrasting this with the Modi government’s efforts to uphold constitutional values

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Defence PSU MIDHANI supplies 31 titanium windows for Ram Temple in Ayodhya
content: This marks the first time titanium is being used as a structural and architectural material in a monument

title: Kerala mulling review petition on SC ruling on setting up primary schools: Minister
content: Minister says Kerala is much ahead of northern States when it comes to educational facilities. Government and aided schools function within a radius of 1-2 km of the majority of the populated areas in the State

title: Kerala local body elections 2025: A shawl, a snapshot, and a swift return
content: Youth Congress leader Akhil Omanakuttan firmly maintains that he never joined the BJP, despite a photograph doing the rounds that shows him smiling with a saffron shawl draped around his shoulder

title: Data exclusivity will extend pharma monopolies, delay access to affordable medicines, activists say
content: In a letter to the Health, Commerce Ministries, activists say India has no global obligation to accept data exclusivity; warn that it will stop the use of existing clinical trial data, harm India’s generics industry

title: Top 5 of CFP unchanged; Ducks leapfrog Ole Miss
content: Ohio State, Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech remained the top five teams in the College Football Playoff rankings, while Oregon jumped ahead of Ole Miss for No. 6 after its win over USC.

title: Luka calls out slippery court after win over Clips
content: Luka Doncic had 43 points and fell one rebound shy of a triple-double but complained about the court conditions for the NBA Cup win over the Clippers.

title: Man pleads guilty in Liverpool title parade crash
content: Paul Doyle has pleaded guilty on the second day of his trial to seriously injuring people when he drove into football fans celebrating Liverpool's victory parade on May 26.

title: Vols, amid 'chatter' over schedule, topple Houston
content: Having heard the "chatter that we hadn't played anybody," Rick Barnes' No. 17 Volunteers took down No. 3 Houston at the Players Era tournament on Tuesday and avenged their loss to the Cougars in last season's Elite Eight.

title: Missing HS coach wanted on criminal charges
content: Travis L. Turner, who disappeared days before his undefeated team's playoff game, faces charges of possessing child sexual abuse material and using a computer to solicit a minor, Virginia State Police said.

title: Okla. State hires UNT's Morris to revive program
content: Eric Morris, who has led North Texas to a 10-1 record this season while averaging 503.3 yards per game, has been hired as the next coach at Oklahoma State.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Lakers clinch behind Doncic, Reaves and James
content: The NBA Cup continues as group play wraps up. Here's everything you need to know about the tournament.

title: How a legendary historian is quietly fueling OKC's championship rise
content: As OKC GM Sam Presti formed a Thunder team built for a dynasty, he was inspired by a man who has been working on the same project for more than 50 years.

title: NFL Week 13 buzz: What we're hearing on the struggling Bucs, Pickens' next deal, fantasy football
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: Fantastic finishes from the biggest games of Rivalry Week
content: The most memorable endings from Ohio State-Michigan, Alabama-Auburn, Clemson-South Carolina and more.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. The pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: The search for one of the ugliest rivalry trophies in college sports: King Spud
content: Is King Spud lost forever? The trophy's vanishing act is one of the stranger mysteries in college sports.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Top 5 holds as Michigan rises, three new teams join
content: The Wolverines make a big jump and Iowa, Kentucky and Vanderbilt crack the top 16 heading into a big weekend.

title: Men's Bracketology: Purdue stays No. 1 overall, but the top four get a shake-up
content: The headlines might not be screaming about them, but we're noticing the Blue Devils' 1-seed-worthy résumé.

title: Bill Belichick's legacy takes a detour at North Carolina
content: A season in, the legendary NFL coach's head-scratching decision to helm a lowly ACC team continues to confound.

title: WWE Survivor Series preview: Can the WarGames teams coexist?
content: Greg Wyshynski breaks down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: How a Dak Prescott initiative saved a Cowboys exec with Stage 2 cancer
content: Dallas QB Dak Prescott and the senior VP of communications look back on their friendship through a fortified bond: "It's bigger than football."

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: Teen star Estevao has Chelsea looking like a team that deserves 'world champions' tag
content: After a win like this in the Champions League over Barcelona, led by teen star Estevao, maybe Chelsea are the real deal after all.

title: Man City's squad issues were made apparent in loss to Leverkusen
content: Despite a rotated lineup, Manchester City's reserves did not showcase their talents and were left exposed.

title: MLB execs predict the offseason: Where will top free agent pitchers land? Does Tucker get $400 million?
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Solak: Should Browns stick with Sanders? Could Colts lose AFC South?
content: Sizing up Shedeur Sanders' first start, the three-team race in AFC South, George Pickens' next contract, more.

title: One year of Amorim: How Man United have changed for the better -- or not
content: It has been one year since Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Man United. There has been some improvement, but the core metrics of Amorim's influence tell a different story.

title: Offseason questions for every NWSL team: A way-too-early look at 2026
content: The NWSL season is over, and the planning for 2026 begins immediately. Here is one burning question for each team.

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Mark Andrews, downgrade Javonte Williams
content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Haney in, Canelo out, Benavidez moves up
content: Where do Devin Haney, David Benavidez and Jesse Rodriguez land after dominant victories? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool 'dream' of signing Bayern Munich's Olise
content: Bayern Munich star Michael Olise would be a "dream" signing for Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ohio State-Michigan, Texas-Texas A&M and betting lines for every Top-25 team
content: This week's odds and FPI predictions for Ohio State-Michigan, Texas-Texas A&M and every top-25 matchup.

title: December schedule hacks: Stack your fantasy hockey lineups with Devils, Mammoth players
content: Your essential guide to lineup strategy for December, including how to use the NHL schedule to your advantage.

title: Pawan Kalyan launches Palle Panduga 2.0 to transform Andhra Pradesh’s rural landscape
content: With a ₹6,787 crore outlay, the programme covers over 13,000 gram panchayats and 53,000 development projects, aiming to double rural infrastructure and enhance livelihoods across villages, he says

title: UDF manifesto for Thrissur will focus on scientific solutions to stray dog menace, waste management: Satheesan
content: Leader of the Opposition calls upon workers to recapture the Thrissur Corporation with a commanding majority

title: 17 girls rescued in Bihar's Rohtas; three accused arrested
content: The police said that three people — Raman Kumar Paswan, Mamata Vishwakarma and Geeta Kuwar — have been arrested so far, while eight other accused are on the run

title: Chitradurga court acquits Murugha Sharana and two others accused under POCSO Act
content: The seer was booked under two POCSO cases after two minor girls from an institution associated with the mutt alleged sexual harassment and exploitation. The acquittal is now in one of the cases.

title: Investigation of Belagavi fake call centre case transferred to CID
content: Earlier, the Cyber, Economic and Narcotic Offences Police, during a raid, arrested 33 accused most of whom come from various States

title: Officials told to expedite Raitanna Meekosam survey in Chittoor
content: Collector tasks officials with visiting the homes of nearly 2.5 lakh farmers across the district and uploading comprehensive details into the Cultivator app

title: 16-year-old girl delivers baby at government hostel washroom in Koppal; youth booked for rape, five others named for negligence
content: In a similar case in August 2025, a Class IX student of a government-run residential school in Yadgir district had given birth to a baby boy in the school’s toilet.

title: Think differently, innovate with open mind, students told
content: The chief technology officer of Aequs sees need for students to collaborate with peers to achieve success in their profession

title: Madanapalle district move generates heat in political and administrative circles of Rayalaseema
content: Though the move is officially projected as an initiative to improve governance, it is broadly viewed as a strategic reshaping of power equations in the region

title: Ahmedabad formally awarded hosting rights of 2030 Commonwealth Games
content: It was a mere formality for the general assembly of 74 members to put a seal of approval on India’s bid after Ahmedabad was recommended as the proposed host of the centenary edition by the Commonwealth Sport’s Executive Board last month

title: Singareni to launch 1 MW battery storage system this week
content: The project will help company make use of 9.1 lakh units of energy commercially every year, which otherwise was being supplied to grid free of cost

title: ‘Active participation of officials is crucial for developing mining-hit areas’
content: Karnataka Mining Environment Restoration Corporation MD chairs review meeting at the NMDC training hall in Donimalai, Sandur taluk

title: Third-party audit will be held for every road accident, says A.P. CM
content: Pointing out that A.P. is eighth among States in accident-related deaths, Naidu gives officials three months to implement speed-control measures

title: Naidu to lay foundation for expansion of Venkateswara Swamy temple in Amaravati on November 27
content: The ₹260 crore project will be taken up in two phases to develop the Venkatapalem shrine into a major spiritual and architectural landmark

title: Proposed law to regulate fees of private educational institutions worries Christians in Assam
content: The Assam Christian Forums said the Assam Private Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) Amendment Bill, 2025 ends the hands-off approach for minority schools

title: Chennai’s Umpherston Street: when names metamorphose
content: This was where P. Venkatachellum started his business of curry powders, sauces, condiments and built an empire that saw his products being sold from Europe to Australia. He was one of the few Dalit successes from Madras in business

title: CJI mulls virtual-only hearings in Supreme Court due to pollution, says felt unwell when he went for walk
content: Senior advocate Kapil Sibal concurred and said, “At our age, we are breathing this obnoxious air when the Air Quality Index (AQI) is 400-500”

title: Country has right to bring back offenders evading law, says Supreme Court
content: According to authorities, 153 cases are registered against petitioner Vijay Murlidhar Udhwani, who had travelled to Dubai in July 2022

title: Pepper farmers in Karnataka expecting sharp decline in output this year
content: Some farmers lost 50% of their vines due to heavy and inconsistent rains. The final impact on production will be known after harvest in February 2026

title: CBI arrests key accused wanted for attack on ED team in Bengal’s Sandeshkhali
content: A mob attacked the ED team when it went to Sandeshkhali to raid the residence of suspended Trinamool Congress leader Shahjahan Sheikh in an alleged ration distribution scam, officials said

title: Court reserves order on Engineer Rashid’s plea for interim bail or custody parole to attend Lok Sabha
content: The court had earlier granted Mr. Rashid custody parole between July 24 and August 4 to attend the Monsoon session of Parliament

title: Election Commission seeks report from Kolkata Police over protest at CEO's office, Mamata says demands of BLOs just
content: Stating that it has taken a “serious view of the incident”, the ECI directed the police to take all possible measures to ensure the safety and security of officers and staff “posted in the office of the CEO, at their residences and while commuting to and fro”

title: Stricter monitoring of midday meals in schools in Mandya district of Karnataka
content: ZP CEO tells education officers to visit schools every 15 days, taste midday meals, and ensure hygiene and quality — from fresh eggs to clean kitchens

title: Bollywood socialite Orry appears before Mumbai police in drugs case
content: According to police, Orhan Awatramani’s name cropped up during the interrogation of Mohammed Salim Mohammed Suhail Shaikh, a key accused in a ₹252 crore mephedrone seizure case

title: 'Indisputable reality': MEA on China's Arunachal claim; slams Indian woman's detention in Shanghai
content: India has strongly protested China's detention of an Indian citizen from Arunachal Pradesh at Shanghai airport, asserting the region's integral status. The Ministry of External Affairs stated that China's denials won't alter this reality, emphasizing the incident violated international norms and China's own transit regulations. Beijing, however, rejected harassment claims.

title: It's official! Ahmedabad to host 2030 CWG; gets final approval
content: Ahmedabad has been officially selected as the host city for the 2030 Commonwealth Games, securing the bid at the Commonwealth Sport's General Assembly in Glasgow. This marks a significant moment for India, as it will be the first time hosting the Games since New Delhi in 2010. The event will celebrate the centenary of the Commonwealth Games.

title: 'Country with stained record of bigotry': India rejects Pak's Ram Temple remark
content: India has strongly rejected Pakistan's objections to Prime Minister Modi's participation in the Ram temple ceremony in Ayodhya. The Ministry of External Affairs called Islamabad's remarks politically motivated and unacceptable, stating Pakistan has no standing on India's internal affairs and accusing them of habitual interference.

title: AI spending race: Mark Cuban warns Perplexity, OpenAI, Google; only one will win
content: Mark Cuban warns leading AI companies like OpenAI and Google are overspending in a race for the most powerful model, comparing it to the 1990s search engine boom. He cautions this intense competition could lead to a bubble, suggesting disruption will likely come from unexpected breakthroughs rather than incremental improvements.

title: Gambhir Samasya: India's Test crisis deepens as South Africa humble hosts 2–0
content: Team India faces a crisis after a crushing defeat to South Africa, revealing deep issues in their Test setup under head coach Gautam Gambhir. A string of home losses and inconsistent performances have eroded India's once-dominant reputation, raising serious questions about direction and selection. This marks a turbulent period for Indian Test cricket.

title: K'taka CM row: Sidda wants high command to decide soon; min confirms push citing DKS' ambition
content: Karnataka minister Satish Jarkiholi revealed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has urged the Congress high command for a swift decision on leadership change. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has consistently expressed his ambition for the chief minister's role. Jarkiholi plans to discuss the matter with Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge.

title: Black Friday sale: HBO Max, Apple TV, Disney+ offer discounts; prices & other details
content: Black Friday 2025 brings massive savings on streaming services. HBO Max offers a 70% discount on its Basic With Ads plan. Disney+ and Hulu bundle together for a reduced monthly price. Apple TV+ also provides a discount on its subscription. These deals offer substantial relief on entertainment bills for consumers.

title: Canada trims 2026 study-permit quota, extends exemptions for graduate-level applicants
content: Canada’s new international student cap marks a decisive shift in its immigration and education framework, sharply reducing study-permit volumes and expanding exemptions for graduate applicants. While the policy aims to curb temporary-resident growth and ease pressure on housing and infrastructure, it also tightens competition for seats, reshapes institutional finances, and alters global student mobility trends.

title: ‘IIT-Bombay as IIT-Mumbai’: Fadnavis to write to PM Modi; move after MNS criticism
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis will write to the Prime Minister and Union Education Ministry to officially rename IIT-Bombay to IIT-Mumbai. This follows criticism from the MNS over Union Minister Jitendra Singh's remarks suggesting the institute should retain its original name. The state government considers the renaming demand legitimate.

title: Where is Imran Khan? Rumours over ex-Pak PM take over social media; sisters assaulted
content: Speculation surrounds Imran Khan's fate after his sisters were allegedly assaulted by police while seeking a meeting. Social media claims he was killed in Adiala Jail, where he has been held since August 2023. His sisters reported a "brutal and orchestrated assault" by Punjab police during a peaceful protest outside the jail.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note for Stephen days after marriage controversy
content: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Why coach Gambhir, chief selector Agarkar are answerable for home debacles
content: Indian cricket faces a crisis after recent home Test series losses. Coach Gautam Gambhir is under pressure amid team's poor performance. Questions arise about planning and player selection. The team's fortress has collapsed, leading to a need for strategic changes. This situation demands attention and a clear path forward for Indian cricket.

title: How to flatter Trump 101: US envoy gave lesson to Russia on peace deal; call exposes coaching
content: A US envoy reportedly advised Russia's top foreign policy adviser on how President Putin should pitch a peace plan to then-President Trump. The plan, discussed with Trump's team, aimed to leverage Trump's perceived role as a "man of peace" following a Gaza deal. The White House described the approach as "standard negotiating procedure."

title: Deepti Chaurasia, daughter-in-law of prominent pan masala group owner, dies by suicide in Delhi
content: A 40-year-old woman, identified as Deepti Chaurasia, daughter-in-law of a pan masala group owner, allegedly died by suicide in Vasant Vihar, south Delhi. Police have recovered a suicide note and are conducting an inquest into the matter. Family members have been interviewed, and an autopsy has been performed.

title: Delhi Capitals co-owner pushes for 'specialist red ball coach' after series loss
content: India men's cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir stated that the BCCI will decide his future following the 2-0 Test series whitewash against South Africa. Gambhir acknowledged the team's recent performance but also highlighted previous successes, including results in England, the Champions Trophy, and the Asia Cup.

title: Charlie McAvoy hit by heartbreak as wife Kiley posts emotional family update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Singer DELAROSA shot dead at 22 in ambush-style attack in LA; fans pay tribute
content: Rising Latin artist DELAROSA, 22, was tragically shot and killed in a violent ambush in Northridge, Los Angeles, over the weekend. The singer was in a parked car when assailants opened fire. Despite being rushed to the hospital, she was pronounced dead on arrival.

title: Massive fire engulfs multiple high rises in Hong Kong; at least 4 dead - video
content: A devastating fire ripped through multiple high-rise towers at Wang Fuk Court in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, claiming at least four lives and trapping several others. Firefighters battled thick smoke billowing from the 31-storey residential blocks, which house approximately 2,000 apartments, as two residents remained in critical condition with burn injuries.

title: Riley Gaines slams ruling as Jammie Booker tops Andrea Thompson at WSW
content: Controversy erupted after Jammie Booker won the World's Strongest Woman competition, with many questioning her gender identity. Riley Gaines publicly criticized Booker's win, sharing a meme and supporting claims that Andrea Thompson was the rightful winner. Gaines has consistently advocated for fairness in women's sports, previously clashing with Simone Biles over trans athletes.

title: Harmer hammer for India: SA spinner surpasses Dale Steyn; breaks multiple records
content: South Africa achieved a historic Test series triumph in India, winning the second Test by a massive 408 runs. This marked India's largest-ever defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win on Indian soil in 25 years. Off-spinner Simon Harmer was instrumental, taking 17 wickets and becoming South Africa's leading wicket-taker in India.

title: Cabinet clears Rs 7,200 cr rare earths scheme - why it’s important
content: India is set to significantly bolster its rare earth magnet production with the Union Cabinet approving a Rs 7,280 crore scheme. This pioneering initiative aims to establish integrated manufacturing facilities, boosting domestic capacity to 6,000 metric tons annually. The seven-year plan focuses on the entire value chain, from oxides to finished magnets, enhancing India's strategic self-reliance.

title: ‘In spur of the moment’: Ex-CJI Gavai reacts to no action after shoe hurling bid
content: Former Chief Justice of India, B.R. Gavai, revealed he acted on instinct during a shoe-hurling attempt in the Supreme Court, choosing to continue hearings immediately.  Despite the incident, he advised the Bar not to be distracted.  The accused lawyer's outburst was reportedly linked to alleged remarks by Gavai, which the former CJI has denied.

title: Mosques take mic: In UP, imams lead the charge to help Muslims navigate SIR confusion
content: Across Muslim-majority neighbourhoods, this new civic refrain has become familiar. Officials say it is a routine update ahead of the 2027 assembly elections. But in neighbourhoods bruised by anxieties around CAA and NRC, the exercise is filled with anxiety.

title: US–China trade thaw? Beijing buys $300 million in US soybeans after Trump–Xi phone call
content: China has purchased at least 10 cargoes of US soybeans, valued at approximately $300 million, following a call between Presidents Trump and Xi. These deals signal a potential thaw in trade relations, with shipments scheduled for January. Despite higher prices than Brazilian alternatives, state-run COFCO has been a significant buyer, with broader purchase agreements in place.

title: Elle Duncan: ESPN star eyes Netflix leap to lead its sports lineup
content: Netflix is reportedly set to hire ESPN host Elle Duncan as its first full-time sportscaster, aiming to bolster its expanding sports division. While a contract isn't finalized, the move could see Duncan become the new face of Netflix's sports content, potentially allowing her to continue some ESPN appearances. This development follows Netflix's increased investment in live sports broadcasting.

title: 'Up to BCCI to decide my future': Gambhir faces heat after 2-0 whitewash; highlights past successes
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir accepted blame for India's Test series defeat, acknowledging the team's collapse against South Africa. While admitting collective failure, he highlighted past successes and stated his future rests with the BCCI. Gambhir defended his selection strategy, emphasising tough characters over flair for Test cricket.

title: Cabinet clears two major rail multitracking projects in Maharashtra & Gujarat - details
content: The Indian government has approved two major railway projects totaling Rs 2,781 crore, adding 224 km of track in Maharashtra and Gujarat. These initiatives aim to boost connectivity, ease congestion, and support economic growth, aligning with the PM Gati Shakti vision. The projects will enhance mobility for millions and significantly improve freight movement, contributing to climate goals.

title: Silent plastic chemicals may be harming hearts and putting millions at risk
content: A major global study warns that everyday plastics, containing phthalates, pose hidden dangers to heart health. These chemicals, found in common household items, are linked to over a lakh heart-related deaths in India annually. Reducing plastic use and choosing safer alternatives can significantly lower exposure and protect against long-term cardiovascular risks.

title: ‘Serious security breach’: EC writes to Kolkata Police; seeks 48-hour action report
content: The Election Commission of India has expressed serious concern over the safety of poll officials in West Bengal following a security breach at the Chief Electoral Officer's office. The ECI has directed Kolkata Police to ensure immediate safety measures for officials at their offices, residences, and during travel, citing the sensitivity of upcoming elections.

title: Delhi again found most polluted; study finds persistently high PM2.5 levels across India
content: Delhi emerges as India's most polluted region, with PM2.5 levels a staggering 20 times the WHO guideline. A new satellite study reveals the Indo-Gangetic airshed remains critically polluted, while the Northeast, particularly Assam-Tripura, is a growing concern.  This year-round crisis demands a shift from city-centric to airshed-based pollution management.

title: Tata Sierra 2025 launched at Rs 11.49 lakh with bold SUV design & luxury interiors
content: The TATA Sierra has returned with a striking makeover, blending luxury, technology, and performance for the premium SUV market. Priced from Rs 11.49 Lakh, it aims to offer an aspirational yet attainable driving experience.  With its "Escape Mediocre" ethos, the Sierra transforms every journey into an extraordinary adventure through comfort, advanced features, and robust performance.

title: Russian oil trade: Discounts soften impact of losing sanctioned barrels
content: US sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil are impacting Indian refiners less than anticipated, as wider discounts on Russian crude offset expected volume drops. Refiners are sourcing from non-sanctioned suppliers, with increased discounts nearly compensating for reduced Russian cargo intake. This shift, coupled with a well-supplied global market, keeps procurement costs stable.

title: Bihar DElEd result 2025 released: Check direct link to download scorecards here
content: Bihar School Examination Board has released the DElEd Joint Entrance Examination 2025 results. Over 2.5 lakh candidates have passed the exam. The pass percentage stands at 79.01%. Admissions to DElEd institutions will commence soon through an online counselling system. The application window opens on November 29 and closes on December 5, 2025.

title: Gentildonna passes away at 16: Tributes pour in for Japan Cup 2012 champion
content: Japanese racing legend Gentildonna, the real horse behind the popular Umamusume character, has passed away at 16. Celebrated for her seven G1 victories, including two Japan Cups and the Triple Tiara, she captivated fans and inspired a generation. Her peaceful passing at Northern Farm marks the end of an illustrious career, leaving a lasting legacy in both racing and gaming.

title: Meerut blue drum murder: Accused Muskan names newborn 'Radha'; in-laws demand DNA test
content: Accused of murdering her husband and concealing his body, Muskan named her newborn daughter Radha. Her in-laws are demanding a DNA test to confirm the baby's parentage, stating they will only accept the child if proven to be Saurabh Rajput's biological daughter. The baby was born on what would have been Saurabh's birthday.

title: Home whitewash: 'Test cricket can't survive on chaos' - Kumble slams Team India
content: India's recent Test series defeat to South Africa has sparked widespread criticism from former cricketers like Anil Kumble and Venkatesh Prasad. They are calling for an urgent overhaul of the team's strategy, citing issues like excessive all-rounder selection and constant team changes. This marks a significant decline in India's home Test performance.

title: New low! India fall below Pakistan in WTC table after 0-2 whitewash against South Africa
content: South Africa completed a historic tour, recording only their second Test series victory in India — and their first since the iconic 2000 triumph under Hansie Cronje. The result also marked India’s biggest defeat by runs in Test cricket, adding further weight to an already bruising outcome. The impact was immediate in the WTC table.

title: Bhopal Lawyer Dies By Suicide After Fraud Call Over Terror Links
content: A 68-year-old senior advocate, Shiv Kumar Verma, died by suicide at his residence in the Jahangirabad area in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday night.

title: 80 Stitches, 2-Hour Surgery: How Madhya Pradesh Doctors Saved Injured Cobra
content: In a rare and dramatic rescue, a cobra injured during construction work in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain was saved after a two-hour surgery in which the reptile received 80 stitches.

title: "Will Be Given Red Carpet Welcome": Top Court On Plea Against Extradition
content: The country has a right to bring back offenders who are evading law, the Supreme Court said on Wednesday as it refused to entertain a plea by a man seeking withdrawal of a request made to the United Arab Emirates for his extradition.

title: CBI Arrests Key Accused Behind Attack On Probe Agency Team In Sandeshkhali
content: A mob attacked the probe agency team when it went to Sandeshkhali to raid the residence of suspended Trinamool Congress leader Shahjahan Sheikh in an alleged ration distribution scam.

title: "Will Not Be Vacated, Come What May": RJD On Rabri Devi Bunglow Row
content: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) on Wednesday said former Bihar chief minister Rabri Devi, wife of its founding president Lalu Prasad, will not vacate the government bungalow she has been occupying for two decades.

title: Trump Says Will Meet Putin And Zelensky 'Only When Ukraine Deal Is Final'
content: President Donald Trump dispatched top negotiators for additional high-level meetings with both Russia and Ukraine but said he would only be willing to meet the leaders of those countries if talks yielded a so-far elusive pact to end the war.

title: Man Poses As IAS, IPS Officers For 2 Years To Dupe People, Arrested
content: Police in Hyderabad have arrested a high-profile white-collar offender, Bathini Shashikanth, for allegedly impersonating senior government officials to cheat and extort money from unsuspecting citizens.

title: Aadhaar Body Deactivates Over 2 Crore Cards Of Dead Individuals
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has deactivated more than two crore Aadhaar numbers belonging to dead individuals, marking one of the largest clean-up exercises of the national identity database.

title: US Embassy Backs India's Efforts To Bring 26/11 Mumbai Attackers To Justice
content: The US Embassy in India on Wednesday backed India's efforts in ensuring that those responsible for the heinous attack are brought to justice.

title: "What's The Crime Of Family?" Ex-Chief Justice BR Gavai On Bulldozer Action
content: Former Chief Justice of India BR Gavai has sharply criticised the use of bulldozers by State authorities to demolish the homes of individuals merely accused of crimes, calling it an alarming example of the executive acting like a court.

title: 13 Dead After Fire Rips Through Seven High-Rise Buildings In Hong Kong
content: A fire spread across seven high-rise apartment buildings in a Hong Kong housing complex, killing 13 people and leaving others still trapped, the city's fire services said Wednesday.

title: Terror Plot Targeting Punjab Foiled, Lawrence Bishnoi Gang Members Arrested
content: A major terror plot was foiled in Punjab after four operatives of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang were arrested after an exchange of fire this afternoon.

title: No Respite In Sight For Delhi Pollution, Chief Justice Of India Weighs In
content: The pollution level in Delhi and National Capital Region set to continue for at least another week, Chief Justice of India Surya Kant has expressed serious concern on the matter.

title: Ahead Of Mumbai Civic Body Polls, 'Credit' War Over Ladki Bahin Scheme
content: With the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation or BMC elections round the corner, political parties are sharpening their electoral strategies, with the state's flagship Ladki-Bahin scheme making headlines over who gets credit for the scheme.

title: Expelled AIADMK Leader KA Sengottaiyan Meets Vijay, Fuels Talk Of TVK Switch
content: Expelled AIADMK strongman KA Sengottaiyan met Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) founder and actor Vijay in Chennai today, intensifying speculation that the expelled nine-time MLA may soon join the fledgling party.

title: Cabinet Clears Rs 7,280 Crore Scheme For Manufacturing Rare Earth Magnets
content: The 'Scheme to Promote Manufacturing of Sintered Rare Earth Permanent Magnets' was approved at a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Google's AI Awakening Sends Alphabet Near $4 Trillion, And Rivals Scrambling
content: Google's newest multipurpose model, Gemini 3, won immediate praise for its capabilities in reasoning and coding, as well as niche tasks that have tripped up AI chatbots.

title: Why A Nitrogen Chamber Protects India's Handwritten Constitution
content: The Constituent Assembly adopted the Constitution on November 26, 1949, and it came into effect on January 26, 1950.

title: LeT Expands Underground Network Across Pakistan In Rapid New Push
content: Pakistan-based terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) is ramping up its presence in the country at an unprecedented pace.

title: Grades for all 32 NHL teams a quarter way through the season
content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: 🎥 Action! Ranking top sports movies since 2000
content: a seton hall sports poll surveyed 1,519 adults in the past quarter century . one title stood out as the defining sports movie of this century, according to a poll . "the blind side" was the sports movie Americans reached for most, edging out another .

title: UConn's Mora leaving to coach Colorado State
content: coach Jim Mora is leaving the school to become the next head coach at Colorado State . he is coming off back-to-back nine-win seasons at the school . the school had been to only one bowl game in the previous 11 years . mora led the team to three bowl seasons in his four years there .

title: Week 14 Anger Index: Why BYU, Notre Dame and others should be mad
content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
